owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has ratified Global Boundary Stratotype Section (GSSP) information
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: GSSP is also informally called 'Golden Spike'

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has hexadecimal RGB color code according to Commission for the Geological Map of the World (CGMW)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A chronostratigraphic unit of smaller scope and rank than a series. It is most commonly of greatest use in intra-continental classification and correlation, although it has the potential for worldwide recognition (NACSN, 1983, Art. 74). The temporal equivalent of stage is age. A stage may be, but need not be, divided into substages. Most stage names are based on lithostratigraphic units, although preferably a stage should have a geographic name not previously used in stratigraphic nomenclature; the adjectival ending for the geographic name is most commonly "-an" or "-ian", although it is permissible to use the geographic name without any special ending, such as "Claiborne Stage". [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

A conventional stratigraphic unit that ranks below a system and always is a division of a system. A series commonly constitutes a major unit of chronostratigraphic correlation within a province, between provinces, or between continents. Although many European series are being adopted increasingly for dividing systems on other continents, provincial series of regional scope continue to be useful (NACSN, 1983, Art. 73). The temporal equivalent of a series is an epoch. Most systems have been divided into series and most series into stages. The term is not restricted to stratified rocks but may be applied to intrusive rocks in the same time-stratigraphic sense. Formal series names are binomial, usually consisting of a geographic name (generally but not necessarily with the adjectival ending "-an" or "-ian") and the word "Series," the initial letter of both terms being capitalized. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

A formally established subdivision of a system [stratig]. "Special circumstances have suggested the occasional need" for subsystems, e.g. the Mississippian Subsystem of the Carboniferous System (ISG, 1976, p.73-74). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

The formal chronostratigraphic unit of rank next lower than erathem and above series. Rocks encompassed by a system represent a time span and an episode of Earth history sufficiently great to serve as a worldwide reference unit (NACSN, 1983, Art. 72). The temporal equivalent of a system is a period. The system is the fundamental unit of chronostratigraphic classification of Phanerozoic rocks. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

The formal chronostratigraphic unit next lower than eonothem and higher than system. Also, the body of rocks formed during the time span of an era. An erathem consists of several adjacent systems (NACSN, 1983, Art. 71). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

The formal chronostratigraphic unit of highest rank. The Phanerozoic Eonothem encompasses the Paleozoic, Mesozoic, and Cenozoic Erathems; all older rocks have been assigned to the Precambrian Eonothem, or to Archean or Proterozoic Eonothems (NACSN, 1983, Art. 70). The body of rocks formed during the time span of an eon. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]
Informal chronostratigraphic unit, composed of eonothems.

A body of rocks established to serve as the material reference for all rocks formed during the same span of time. Each of its boundaries is synchronous. The body also serves as the basis for defining the specific interval of time, or geochronologic unit, represented by the referent (NACSN, 1983, Art. 66). Chronostratigraphic units in order of decreasing rank: eonothem, erathem, system, series, stage. Syn: chronostratic unit; chronolithologic unit; time-stratigraphic unit; time-rock unit; chronolith.[AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]
The formal geochronologic unit of lowest rank, below epoch, during which the rocks of the corresponding stage or substage (chronostratigraphic units) were formed. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]
The formal geochronologic unit longer than an age and shorter than a period, during which the rocks of the corresponding series were formed. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]
A geochronologic unit that is a portion of a period, but longer than an epoch, during which the rocks of the corresponding subsystem were formed. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

The geochronologic unit lower in rank than era and higher than epoch, during which the rocks of the corresponding system were formed. It is the fundamental unit of the worldwide geologic time scale. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

The formal geochronologic unit next in order of magnitude below an eon, during which the rocks of the corresponding erathem were formed; e.g. the Paleozoic Era, the Mesozoic Era, and the Cenozoic Era. Each of these includes two or more periods, during each of which a system of rocks was formed. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

The largest unit of geologic time; immediately above era in the geochronologic hierarchy; the time during which the rocks of an eonothem were formed (ISSC, 1994, p.83). The Phanerozoic Eon encompasses the Paleozoic, Mesozoic, and Cenozoic Eras. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]
Informal geochronologic unit, composed of eons.

A division of time traditionally distinguished on the basis of the rock record as expressed by a chronostratigraphic unit. It is not a material unit but corresponds to the time span of an established chronostratigraphic unit (NACSN, 1983, Art. 80). Geochronologic units in order of decreasing rank are eon, era, period, epoch, and age. Names of periods and units of lower rank are the same as those of the corresponding chronostratigraphic units; the names of some eras and eons are independently formed.[AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

owl:Thing.dct:title: Ontology Geological Time Scale
owl:Thing.dct:creator: Xiaogang Ma
owl:Thing.dct:description: An arbitrary chronologic arrangement or sequence of geologic events, used as a measure of the relative or absolute duration or age of any part of geologic time, and usually presented in the form of a chart showing the names of the various rock-stratigraphic, time-stratigraphic, or geologic-time units, as currently understood; e.g. the geologic time scales published by Harland et al. (1982), Odin (1982), Palmer (1983), and Salvador (1985). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Eonothem.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=156-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Eonothem.rdfs:comment: The uppermost eonothem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale. It comprises the Paleozoic, Mesozoic and Cenozoic erathems, which include rocks with abundant evidence of life. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Phanerozoic Eon. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Supereonothem.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Supereonothem.rdfs:comment: A commonly used term to designate all rocks older than the Cambrian Period of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale. It includes the Archean and Proterozoic eonothems and represents 90 percent of geologic time. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Eonothem.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Eonothem.rdfs:comment: The upper eonothem of the Precambrian of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Archean and below the Phanerozoic Eonothem. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Eonothem.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Eonothem.rdfs:comment: The lowest eonothem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, below the Proterozoic Eonothem. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Eonothem.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Eonothem.rdfs:comment: A suggested eonothem of the Precambrian, older than the lowest preserved rocks (>~3,800 Ma). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Erathem.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=34-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Erathem.rdfs:comment: The upper erathem of the Phanerozoic Eonothem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Cenozoic Era. It is characterized paleontologically by the evolution and abundance of mammals and angiosperm plants. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Erathem.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=76-top_parentid=35 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Erathem.rdfs:comment: The middle erathem of the Phanerozoic Eonothem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Paleozoic and below the Cenozoic. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Mesozoic Era. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Erathem.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=156-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Erathem.rdfs:comment: The lowest erathem of the Phanerozoic Eonothem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Precambrian and below the Mesozoic. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Paleozoic Era. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Erathem.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Erathem.rdfs:comment: An erathem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: the uppermost erathem of the Proterozoic Eonothem. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Erathem.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Erathem.rdfs:comment: An erathem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: the middle erathem of the Proterozoic Eonothem. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Erathem.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Erathem.rdfs:comment: An erathem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: the lowest erathem of the Proterozoic Eonothem. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Erathem.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Erathem.rdfs:comment: An erathem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: the uppermost erathem of the Archean Eonothem. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Erathem.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Erathem.rdfs:comment: An erathem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: the third-lowest erathem of the Archean Eonothem. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Erathem.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Erathem.rdfs:comment: An erathem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: the second-lowest erathem of the Archean Eonothem. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Erathem.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Erathem.rdfs:comment: An erathem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: the lowest formally defined erathem of the Archean Eonothem. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=10-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: The upper system of the Cenozoic Erathem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Neogene System. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Quaternary Period.[AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology, with changes to information related to Tertiary]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=21-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: The middle system of the Cenozoic Erathem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Paleogene System and below the Quaternary System. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Neogene Period. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology, with changes to information related to Tertiary]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=34-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: The lower system of the Cenozoic Erathem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Cretaceous and below the Neogene System. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Paleogene Period. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology, , with changes to information related to Tertiary]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: The upper system of the Mesozoic Erathem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Jurassic and below the Paleogene System of the Cenozoic Erathem. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Cretaceous Period. It is named after the Latin word for chalk ("creta") because of the English chalk beds of this age. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology, , with changes to information related to Tertiary]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/Stratigraphy/gssp/index.php?parentid=35 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: The middle system of the Mesozoic Erathem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Triassic and below the Cretaceous. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Jurassic Period. It is named after the Jura Mountains between France and Switzerland, in which rocks of this age were first studied. Informally called: age of cycads. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=76-top_parentid=35 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: The lower system of the Mesozoic Erathem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Permian System of the Paleozoic Erathem and below the Jurassic System. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Triassic Period. It was named because of its threefold lithostratigraphic division in Germany. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=90-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: The uppermost system of the Paleozoic Erathem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Carboniferous and below the Triassic System of the Mesozoic Erathem. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Permian Period. It is named after the province of Perm, Russia, where rocks of this age were first studied. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=106-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: A system of the late Paleozoic Erathem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Devonian and below the Permian. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Carboniferous Period. Named after its coal-rich deposits in Europe and North America. The system is subdivided into two subsystems: the Mississippian (older) and the Pennsylvanian (younger). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=117-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: A system of the Paleozoic Erathem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Silurian and below the Carboniferous. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Devonian Period. It is named after Devonshire, England, where rocks of this age were first studied. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=130-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: A system of the Paleozoic Erathem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Ordovician and below the Devonian. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Silurian Period. It is named after the Silures, a Celtic tribe. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=141-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: A system of the Paleozoic Erathem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Cambrian and below the Silurian. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Ordovician Period. It is named after a Celtic tribe called the Ordovices. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=156-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: The lowest system of the Paleozoic Erathem of the Standard Global Geochronometric Scale. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Cambrian Period. Named after "Cambria", the Roman name for Wales, where rocks of this age were first studied. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=159-top_parentid=181 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: A system of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: the uppermost system of the Neoproterozoic Erathem and of the Precambrian, characterized by the earliest, well-documented soft-bodied forms of metazoan life. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: A system of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: middle system of the Neoproterozoic Erathem, characterized by global glaciation ("cryos", "ice", and "genesis", "birth"). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: A system of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: the lowest system of the Neoproterozoic Erathem, characterized by expansion of platform cover ("tonas", "stretch"). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: A system of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: the uppermost system of the Mesoproterozoic Erathem, characterized by narrow belts of tectonic activity ("stenos", "narrow"). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: A system of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: the middle system of the Mesoproterozoic Erathem, characterized by continued expansion of platform covers ("ektasis", "extension"). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: A system of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: the lowest system of the Mesoproterozoic Erathem, characterized by expansion of platform covers ("calymma", "cover"). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: A system of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: the uppermost system of the Paleoproterozoic Erathem, characterized by craton expansion ("statheros", "stable, firm"). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: A system of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: the third-lowest system of the Paleoproterozoic Erathem, characterized by a global orogenic event ("orosira", "mountain range"). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: A system of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: the second-lowest system of the Paleoproterozoic Erathem, characterized by injection of layered complexes ("rhyax", "stream of lava"). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:System.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:System.rdfs:comment: A system of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: the lowest system of the Paleoproterozoic Erathem, characterized by an abundance of banded iron formations ("sideros", "iron"). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=5-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The upper series of the Quaternary System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Pleistocene. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Holocene Epoch. The term has replaced the earlier "Recent" as a formal name. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=10-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The lower series of the Quaternary System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Pliocene Series of the Tertiary System and below the Holocene Series. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Pleistocene Epoch. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=14-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The uppermost series of the Neogene System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Miocene and below the Pleistocene Series of the Quaternary System. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Pliocene Epoch. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=21-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: A series of the Neogene System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Oligocene and below the Pliocene. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Miocene Epoch. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=25-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The upper series of the Paleogene System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Eocene and below the Miocene Series of the Neogene System. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Oligocene Epoch. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=30-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The middle series of the Paleogene System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Paleocene and below the Oligocene. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Eocene Epoch. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=34-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The lower series of the Paleogene System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Cretaceous System and below the Eocene Series. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Paleocene Epoch. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=43-top_parentid=35 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The upper series of the Cretaceous System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Lower Cretaceous and below the Paleocene System. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Late Cretaceous Epoch.

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The lower series of the Cretaceous System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Jurassic System and below the Upper Cretaceous Series. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Early Cretaceous Epoch.

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The upper series of the Jurassic System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Middle Jurassic Series and below the Cretaceous System. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Late Jurassic Epoch.

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=60-top_parentid=35 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The middle series of the Jurassic System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Lower Jurassic and below the Upper Jurassic Series. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Middle Jurassic Epoch.

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/Stratigraphy/gssp/index.php?parentid=35 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The lower series of the Jurassic System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Triassic System and below the Middle Jurassic Series. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Early Jurassic Epoch.

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/Stratigraphy/gssp/index.php?parentid=35 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The upper series of the Triassic System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Middle Triassic Series and below the Jurassic System. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Late Triassic Epoch.

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The middle series of the Triassic System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Lower Triassic and below the Upper Triassic Series. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Middle Triassic Epoch.

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=76-top_parentid=35 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The lower series of the Triassic System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Permian System of the Paleozoic Erathem and below the Middle Triassic Series. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Middle Triassic Epoch.

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=81-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: A series of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: Upper Permian (above Guadalupian Series, below Triassic System of Mesozoic Erathem). The basal GSSP is in China. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=85-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: A series of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: Middle Permian (above Cisuralian, below Lopingian). The basal GSSP in the Guadalupe Mountains, Texas, USA, coincides with the lowest occurrence of the conodont Jinogondolella nankingensis. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=90-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: A series of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: Lower Permian (below Guadalupian Series, above Carboniferous System). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Subsystem.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=99-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Subsystem.rdfs:comment: The upper subsystem of the Carboniferous System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Mississippian Subsystem and below the Permian System. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Pennsylvanian Subperiod. It is named after the State of Pennsylvania, in which rocks of this age are widespread and yield much coal. It is the approximate equivalent of the Upper Carboniferous of some chronostratigraphic scales. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Subsystem.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=106-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Subsystem.rdfs:comment: The lower subsystem of the Carboniferous System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Devonian System and below . the Pennsylvanian Subsystem. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Mississippian Subperiod. It is named after the Mississippi River valley, in which there are good exposures of rocks of this age and is the approximate equivalent of the Lower Carboniferous of some chronostratigraphic scales. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The upper series of the Pennsylvanian Subystem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Middle Pennsylvanian Series and below the Permian System. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Late Pennsylvanian Epoch.
gts:Series.skos:prefLabel: 上部ペンシルバニア系
gts:Series.skos:altLabel: ペンシルバニア紀後期

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The middle series of the Pennsylvanian Subystem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Lower Pennsylvanian Series and below the Upper Pennsylvanian Series. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Middle Pennsylvanian Epoch.

gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The lower series of the Pennsylvanian Subystem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Mississippian Subsystem and below the Middle Pennsylvanian Series. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Early Pennsylvanian Epoch.

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The upper series of the Mississippian Subystem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Middle Mississippian Series and below the Pennsylvanian Subsystem. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Late Mississippian Epoch.
gts:Series.skos:prefLabel: 上部ミシシッピアン系
gts:Series.skos:altLabel: ミシシッピアン紀後期
後期ミシシッピアン紀
ミシシッピアン系上部

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/Stratigraphy/gssp/index.php?parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The middle series of the Mississippian Subystem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Lower Mississippian Series and below the Upper Mississippian Series. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Middle Mississippian Epoch.
gts:Series.skos:prefLabel: 中部ミシシッピアン系
gts:Series.skos:altLabel: ミシシッピアン紀中期
中期ミシシッピアン紀

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=106-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The lower series of the Mississippian Subystem of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Devonian System and below the Middle Mississippian Series. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Early Mississippian Epoch.
gts:Series.skos:prefLabel: 下部ミシシッピアン系
gts:Series.skos:altLabel: ミシシッピアン紀前期
前期ミシシッピアン紀

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=110-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The upper series of the Devonian System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Middle Devonian Series and below the Carboniferous System. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Late Devonian Epoch.

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=113-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The middle series of the Devonian System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Lower Devonian Series and below the Upper Devonian Series. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Middle Devonian Epoch.

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=117-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The lower series of the Devonian System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Silurian System and below the Middle Devonian Series. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Early Devonian Epoch.

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=120-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: A series of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: Uppermost Silurian (above Ludlow Series, below Devonian System). The basal GSSP is near Prague, Czech Republic (Holland, 1985). Also called: Pridolian. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=123-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: A series of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: Upper Silurian (above Wenlock, below Pridoli Series). The basal GSSP is in southwest England (Holland, 1982). Also called: Ludlovian. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=126-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: A series of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: Middle Silurian (above Llandovery, below Ludlow Series). The basal GSSP is in southwest England (Holland, 1982). Also called: Wenlockian. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=130-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: A series of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: Lower Silurian (above Ordovician System, below Wenlock Series). Also called: Llandoverian. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=135-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The upper series of the Ordovician System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Middle Ordovician Series and below the Silurian System. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Late Ordovican Epoch.

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=138-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The middle series of the Ordovician System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Lower Ordovician Series and below the Upper Ordovician Series. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Middle Ordovician Epoch.

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=141-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The lower series of the Ordovician System of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale, above the Cambrian System and below the Middle Ordovician Series. Also the time during which these rocks were formed, the Early Ordovician Epoch.

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=146-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: A series of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: uppermost Cambrian Series (above unnamed series 3 of middle Cambrian System, below Lower Ordovician Series). The name "Furongian" is from Furong, meaning "lotus," referring to Hunan, the Lotus State. The basal GSSP is near Paibi in Hunan, China, and was ratified in 2003. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: A unnamed series of Cambrian System, below Furongian Series and above Series 2.

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=156-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: In International Stratigraphic Chart 2010, 'Lower Cambrian' is splitted into two series: Series 2 and Terreneuvian.

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: A unnamed series of Cambrian System, below Series 3 and above Terreneuvian Series.

gts:Series.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=156-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Series.rdfs:comment: The lowest series of Cambrian System, below Series 2 and above Proterozoic Eonothem.

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: The uppermost stage of Pleistocene Epoch, below Holocene Epoch and above Ionian Stage.

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of middle Pleistocene Epoch, below Upper Pleistocene Stage and above Calabrian Stage.

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=9-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of lower Pleistocene Epoch, below Ionian Stage and above Gelasian Stage.

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=10-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lowermost Pleistocene (above Pliocene Series, below Calabrian Stage). The basal GSSP is in Sicily, Italy (Rio et al., 1998).

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=13-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: upper Pliocene Series (above Zanclean Stage, below Pleistocene Series). The basal GSSP is in Sicily, Italy (Castradori et al., 1998).

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=14-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lower Pliocene (above Messinian Stage of the Miocene Series, below Piacenzian Stage). The basal GSSP is in Sicily, Italy (Van Couvering et al., 2000). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=16-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: uppermost Miocene (above Tortonian, below the Zanclean Stage of the Pliocene). The basal GSSP is near Rabat, Morocco (Hilgen et al., 2000). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=17-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lower upper Miocene (above Serravallian, below Messinian). The basal GSSP is near Ancona, Italy. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=18-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: upper middle Miocene (above Langhian, below Tortonian). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lower middle Miocene (above Burdigalian, below Serravallian). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: upper lower Miocene (above Aquitanian Stage, below Langhian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=21-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lowermost Miocene (above Chattian Stage of Oligocene Series, below Burdigalian Stage) The basal GSSP is north of Genoa, Italy (Steininger et al., 1997). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: upper Oligocene (above Rupelian Stage, below Aquitanian Stage of the Miocene Series). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=25-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lower Oligocene (above Priabonian Stage of the Eocene Series, below Chattian Stage). The basal GSSP is near Ancona, Italy (Premoli Silva and Jenkins, 1993). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: Upper Eocene (above Bartonian Stage, below Rupelian Stage of the Oligocene Series). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: upper middle Eocene (above Lutetian Stage, below Priabonian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lower middle Eocene (above Ypresian Stage, below Bartonian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=30-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lowermost Eocene (above Thanetian Stage of the Paleocene Series, below Lutetian Stage). The basal GSSP is near Luxor, Egypt. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/Stratigraphy/gssp/index.php?parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: upper Paleocene (above Selandian Stage, below Ypresian Stage of the Eocene Series). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/Stratigraphy/gssp/index.php?parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: middle Paleocene (above Danian Stage, below Thanetian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=34-top_parentid=2 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lowermost Paleocene and base of Cenozoic (above Maastrichtian Stage of Cretaceous System, below Selandian Stage). The basal GSSP in Tunisia coincides with global iridium anomaly. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=38-top_parentid=35 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: uppermost Cretaceous (above Campanian, below Danian Stage of the Paleocene Series). The basal GSSP is in southwest France (Odin and Lamaurelle, 2001). Occasionally spelled: Maestrichtian. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]
gts:Stage.skos:prefLabel: マーストリヒシアン階
gts:Stage.skos:altLabel: マーストリヒシアン期

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: upper Upper Cretaceous (above Santonian Stage, below Maastrichtian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: middle Upper Cretaceous (above Coniacian Stage, below Campanian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: middle Upper Cretaceous (above Turonian Stage, below Santonian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=42-top_parentid=35 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lower Upper Cretaceous (above Cenomanian Stage, below Coniacian Stage). The basal GSSP is in Colorado, USA. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=43-top_parentid=35 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lowermost Upper Cretaceous (above Albian Stage of Lower Cretaceous Series, below Turonian Stage). The basal GSSP is in southeast France. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: uppermost Lower Cretaceous (above Aptian Stage, below Cenomanian Stage of Upper Cretaceous Series). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: upper Lower Cretaceous, (above Barremian Stage, below Albian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: middle Lower Cretaceous (above Hauterivian Stage, below Aptian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: middle Lower Cretaceous (above Valanginian Stage, below Barremian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lower Lower Cretaceous (above Berriasian Stage, below Hauterivian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lowermost Cretaceous (above Tithonian Stage of Jurassic System, below Valanginian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: uppermost Jurassic (above Kimmeridgian Stage, below Berriasian Stage of the Cretaceous System) [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: middle Upper Jurassic (above Oxfordian Stage, below Tithonian Stage). The spelling "Kimeridgian" was used by Arkell (1956, p.20) on the basis that the type locality, the village of Kimmeridge in the Isle of Purbeck, southern England, was spelled with one "m" until 1892. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lowermost Upper Jurassic (above Callovian Stage of Middle Jurassic Series, below Kimmeridgian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]
gts:Stage.skos:prefLabel: オックスフォーディアン階
gts:Stage.skos:altLabel: オックスフォーディアン期

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: uppermost Middle Jurassic (above Bathonian Stage, below Oxfordian Stage of Upper Jurassic Series). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=58-top_parentid=35 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: Middle Jurassic (above Bajocian Stage, below Callovian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=59-top_parentid=35 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: Middle Jurassic (above Aalenian Stage, below Bathonian Stage). The basal GSSP is at Cabo Mondego in Portugal (Pavia and Enay, 1997). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=60-top_parentid=35 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lowermost Middle Jurassic (above Toarcian Stage of Lower Jurassic Series, below Bajocian Stage). The basal GSSP is at Fuentelsalz in central Spain. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: uppermost Lower Jurassic (above Pliensbachian Stage, below Aalenian Stage of Middle Jurassic Series). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=63-top_parentid=35 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: middle Lower Jurassic (above Sinemurian Stage, below Toarcian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]
gts:Stage.skos:prefLabel: プリンスバッキアン階
gts:Stage.skos:altLabel: プリンスバッキアン期

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=64-top_parentid=35 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: Lower Jurassic (above Hettangian Stage, below Pliensbachian Stage). The basal GSSP is in southwest England (Bloos and Page, 2002). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/Stratigraphy/gssp/index.php?parentid=35 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lowermost Jurassic (above Rhaetian Stage of Triassic System, below Sinemurian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: uppermost Triassic (above Norian Stage, below Hettangian Stage of Jurassic System). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: Upper Triassic (above Carnian Stage, below Rhaetian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/Stratigraphy/gssp/index.php?parentid=35 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: Upper Triassic (above Ladinian Stage of Middle Triassic Series, below Norian Stage). Also spelled: Karnian. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=72-top_parentid=35 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: upper Middle Triassic (above Anisian Stage, below Carnian Stage of Upper Triassic Series). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lower Middle Triassic (above Olenekian Stage of Lower Triassic Series, below Ladinian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: Lower Triassic (above Induan Stage, below Anisian Stage of Middle Triassic Series). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=76-top_parentid=35 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lowermost Triassic (above Changhsingian Stage of the Permian System, below Olenekian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=80-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: uppermost stage of the Permian (uppermost stage of Lopingian Series; above Wuchiapingian Stage, below Induan Stage of the Triassic System). Some authors spell the term "Changxingian". [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=81-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lower stage of Lopingian Series of upper Permian (above Capitanian Stage of Guadalupian Series, below Changhsingian Stage). The basal GSSP is in China. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=83-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: upper stage of the Guadalupian Series (middle Permian; above Wordian Stage, below Wuchiapingian Stage of Lopingian Series). The basal GSSP is in the Guadalupe Mountains, Texas, USA. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=84-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: middle stage of the Guadalupian Series, middle Permian (above Roadian Stage, below Capitanian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=85-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lowest stage of the Guadalupian Series, middle Permian (above Kungurian Stage of Cisuraian Series, below Wordian Stage). The basal GSSP is in the Guadalupe Mountains, Texas, USA. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: uppermost Cisuraian Series, lower Permian (above Artinskian Stage, below Roadian Stage of Guadalupian Series). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: middle Cisuralian Series, Lower Permian (above Sakmarian Stage, below Kungurian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]
gts:Stage.skos:prefLabel: アルティンスキアン階
gts:Stage.skos:altLabel: アルティンスキアン期

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: middle Cisuralian Series, lower Permian (above Asselian Stage, below Artinskian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=90-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lowermost stage of the Cisuralian Series, lower Permian(above Carboniferous System, below Sakmarian Stage). The basal GSSP (base of Permian) is in northern Kazakhstan (Davydov et al., 1998). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: uppermost Carboniferous (above Kasimovian Stage, below Permian System). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: middle of Pennsylvanian Subsystem of Carboniferous (above Moscovian Stage, below Gzhelian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: middle of the Pennsylvanian Subsystem of the Carboniferous (above Bashkirian Stage, below Kasimovian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=99-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lowest stage of the Pennsylvanian Subsystem, upper Carboniferous (above Serpukhovian Stage of Mississippian Subsystem, below Moscovian Stage). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: uppermost unit of Mississippian Subsystem of the Carboniferous (above Visean Stage, below Bashkirian Stage of Pennsylvanian Subsystem). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/Stratigraphy/gssp/index.php?parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lower Carboniferous (above Tournaisian Stage, below Serpukhovian Stage). Also spelled: Viséan. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=106-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A series or stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lowermost Carboniferous (above Famennian Stage of the Devonian System, below Visean Stage). The basal GSSP is at Montagne Noir, southern France (Paproth et al., 1991). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=109-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: uppermost Devonian (above Frasnian Stage, below Tournaisian Stage of the Carboniferous System). The basal GSSP is at Montagne Noir, southern France (Klapper et al., 1993). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=110-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: of Upper Devonian (above Givetian Stage of Middle Devonian Series, below Famennian Stage). The basal GSSP is at Montagne Noir, southern France (Klapper et al., 1987). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=112-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: of Middle Devonian (above Eifelian, below Frasnian Stage of Upper Devonian Series). The basal GSSP is near Tafilait, Morocco (Walliser et al., 1995). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=113-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: of Middle Devonian (above Emsian Stage of Lower Devonian Series, below Givetian Stage). The basal GSSP is in the Eifel plateau, western Germany (Ziegler and Klapper, 1985). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=115-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: of Lower Devonian (above Pragian Stage, below Eifelian Stage of Middle Devonian Series). The basal GSSP is near Smarkand, Uzbekistan (Yolkin et el., 1997). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=116-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: of Lower Devonian (above Lochkovian Stage, below Emsian Stage). The basal GSSP is near Prague, Czech Republic (Chlupac and Oliver, 1989). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=117-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lowermost Devonian (above Silurian System, below Pragian Stage). The basal GSSP is near Prague, Czech Republic (Martinsson, 1977). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=122-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: upper stage of Ludlow Series of the Upper Silurian (above the Gorstian Stage, below the Pridoli Series). The basal GSSP is in southwest England (Holland, 1982). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]
gts:Stage.skos:prefLabel: ルドフォーディアン階
gts:Stage.skos:altLabel: ルドフォーディアン期

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=123-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lowermost stage of the Ludlow Series of the Upper Silurian (above the Homerian Stage, below the Ludfordian Stage). The basal GSSP is in southwest England (Holland, 1982). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=125-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: upper stage of the Wenlockian Series (above the Sheinwoodian Stage, below the Gorstian Stage of Ludlow Series). The basal GSSP is in southwest England (Holland, 1982). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=126-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lowermost stage of Wenlockian Series, middle Silurian (above Telychian Stage, below Homerian Stage). The basal GSSP is in southwest England (Holland, 1982). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]
gts:Stage.skos:prefLabel: シェインウッディアン階
gts:Stage.skos:altLabel: シェインウッディアン期

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=128-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: uppermost stage of the Llandovery Series, lower Silurian (above Aeronian Stage, below Sheinwoodian Stage of Wenlock Series). The basal GSSP is in Wales (Holland, 1985). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=129-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: middle stage of Llandovery Series, lower Silurian (above the Rhuddanian Stage, below the Telychian Stage). The basal GSSP is in Wales (Holland, 1985). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=130-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lowermost stage of the Llandoverian Series, lower Silurian (above the Ordovician System, below the Aeronian Stage). The basal GSSP is at Dob's Lin, Scotland (Cocks, 1985). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=133-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: uppermost stage of the Upper Ordovician Series (above Katian Stage, below the Silurian system).

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=134-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: middle stage of the Upper Ordovician Series (above Sandbian Stage, below Hirnantian Stage).

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=135-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lower stage of the Upper Ordovician Series (above Darriwilian Stage of Middle Ordovician Series, below Katian Stage).

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=137-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: upper Middle Ordovician (above Dapingian Stage, below Sandbian Stage of Upper Ordovician Series). The basal GSSP is in Zhejiang Province, China, and was ratified 1997 (Mitchell et al., 1997). [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=138-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lower Middle Ordovician (above Floian Stage of Lower Ordovician Series, below Darriwilian Stage).

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=140-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: upper stage of Lower Ordovician (above Tremadocian Stage, below Dapingian Stage of Middle Ordovician Series).

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: https://engineering.purdue.edu/stratigraphy/gssp/detail.php?periodid=141-top_parentid=77 [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A stage of the Standard Global Chronostratigraphic Scale: lowermost Ordovician (above Cambrian system, below Florian Stage). The basal GSSP is in Newfoundland (Cooper et al., 2001). Also spelled: Tremadoc. [AGI, 2010. Glossary of Geology]

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A unnamed stage: uppermost stage of Furongian Series, Cambrian System.

gts:Stage.gts:gsspInfo: Not available or waiting for ratification (by Dec 2010) [Subcommission for Stratigraphic Information of ICS, 2010, GSSP Table]
gts:Stage.rdfs:comment: A unnamed stage: middle stage of Furongian Series, Cambrian System.
